title: Tracking Issue for simple_fmt

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

body:
Feature gate: `#![feature(simple_fmt)]`

This is a tracking issue for the `simple_fmt` method on the `Display` format trait.

### Public API

```diff
  pub trait Display {
      fn fmt(&self, f: &mut Formatter) -> Result;
+     fn simple_fmt(&self, f: &mut Formatter) -> Result {
+         self.fmt(f)
+     }
  }
```

Formatting placeholders without any options, like in `format_args!("{}", x)`, will call the `simple_fmt` method rather than `fmt`. This allows for optimized implementations for e.g. `<String as Display>::simple_fmt` that do not need to pull in code for padding, etc. See https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/104525#issuecomment-1318399783.

### Steps / History

- [ ] Implementation: #104525
- [ ] Final comment period (FCP)
- [ ] Stabilization PR

### Unresolved Questions

- [ ] Do we want this on the other formatting traits too? Or only `Display`?
- [ ] Do we want to stabilize this at all, to allow crates to override `simple_fmt` for their own types?
- [ ] Should the method be `unsafe`, such that the implementation may unsafely assume that the `Formatter`'s options are all set to default?
